title: Doylestown Area Egg Hunts and Easter Events
author: Staff
excerpt: Ongoing, thru April 24th PEEPS in the Village, Peddler’s Village, Lahaska This spring, Peddler’s Village presents the 3rd Annual PEEPS in the Village, on display from Friday, March 11 through Sunday, April 24. content:
Ongoing, thru April 24th

PEEPS in the Village, Peddler’s Village, Lahaska

This spring, Peddler’s Village presents the 3rd Annual PEEPS in the Village, on display from Friday, March 11 through Sunday, April 24. The colorful display will include more than 70 creations of wall art, dioramas, and sculpture, featuring the popular Pennsylvania-made bunnies and chicks, and carefully handmade and contributed by Philly-area residents and organizations. Admission to the display is free. Housed in the Red Barn, located off Street Road and Peddler’s Lane. 

Saturday, April 2nd, 10am 

New Britain Township Parks & Recreation Annual Easter Egg Hunt, North Branch Park, 207 Park Avenue, Chalfont

Egg hunt begins at 10am sharp; photos with the Easter Bunny will begin at 9:30 am. Non-perishable goods and monetary donations will be collected and donated to the New Britain Food Pantry. In the case of inclement weather, the event rain date is 4/9/22. 

Saturday, April 2nd, 2-3pm

Doggie Eggstravaganza at Peace Valley Nature Center, 

170 North Chapman Road, Doylestown

Your furry friend will love our doggie egg hunt! Eggs contain either a treat or a prize, and don’t forget your basket. Dogs must be 4 months or older, up to date on vaccinations, and on a non-retractable leash no longer than 6 feet. Friendly non food-aggressive dogs and their humans are welcome. $10 per dog, $5 for members. Register at peacevalleynaturecenter.org.

Saturday, April 2nd and Sunday April 3rd, Saturday April 9th and Sunday April 10th

Selfies with the Easter Bunny at Mercantile at Doylestown, 444-446 N. Main St., Doylestown

Register online at mercantiledoylestown.com. There will not be a photographer present; this is a selfie opportunity only. 

Sunday, April 3rd

Easter Activities at Solly Farm, 707 Almshouse Road, Ivyland

Mr. & Mrs. Bunny will be here for Easter activities! Hayrides followed by an egg hunt will run every 30 minutes. At the end of each egg hunt, one of the Bunnies will provide a special treat to each child. Cost is $6 per person. 

Sundays, April 3rd and April 10th, 1-2pm

Easter Egg Hunt at Mercantile at Doylestown, 444-446 N. Main St., Doylestown

Get ready for the Mercantile’s indoor Easter Egg Hunt! Will you be the one to find the Golden Egg? This event is open to children ages 2-12 years old. Parents are required to accompany their children at all times. Sign up at mercantiledoylestown.com.

Saturday, April 9th, 10am-12pm

Family Ministry Easter Egg-Stravaganza at St. Paul’s Lutheran Church, Doylestown

Join us for a morning filled with stories, crafts, snacks, and an indoor Easter Egg hunt where everyone’s a winner! We will be crafting bags for the Easter egg hunt. Participants are asked to bring items for Home at Last Animal Rescue. Please RSVP online, at doylestownlutheran.org.

Saturday, April 9th, 10am-12pm

Easter Bunny Photos through Discover Doylestown in Doylestown Borough. 

See discoverdoylestown.org for details. 

Saturday, April 9th, 10am-1pm

Annual Egg Hunt at the Barn Nature Center, 1283 Almshouse Rd, Doylestown

Bunny Photo Booth! Visits with egg-laying animals! Egg Decorating Contest! Bring Your Own Basket! Rain or shine, $15 per child, $10 per adult. Register at barnnaturecenter.org

Saturday, April 16th at 10am, 12pm, or 2pm

Old-Fashioned Easter Egg Hunt at Peddler’s Village, Lahaska

Hop over to the Visitor and Event Center field for an Old-Fashioned Egg Hunt! This is a timed and ticketed event with limited capacity for each time. Each time slot features separate areas for ages 1-3, 4-7, and 8-10. Cost is $10/child. Children receive: an Easter basket, 6 candy-filled eggs during the hunt, a prize during the hunt, a chance to win the Grand Prize, and Easter Bunny appearances. Reserve online at peddlersvillage.com.

Saturdays, April 2nd, 9th, and 16th, and Sundays April 3rd, 10th, and 17th

Easter Brunch at the Elmwood Park Zoo, 1661 Harding Blvd Norristown

Enjoy a delicious breakfast, participate in Easter activities, and meet one of the beloved education animals. Don’t forget to grab a photo with the Easter Bunny and then enjoy exploring the zoo! There are three brunch sessions each day: 10am, 11:15am, and 12:30pm. Rain or shine event. Purchase tickets and register at elmwoodparkzoo.org. 

Sunday April 10th, Thursday April 14, Friday April 15th, Saturday April 9th and 16th

Easter Eggstravaganza at Shadybrook Farm, 931 Stony Hill Rd., Yardley

Take a wagon ride to the “hunting grounds” where kids will find 6 candy-filled eggs. Return to the festival field to meet the Easter bunny, get a prize, and enjoy the many activities. Children under 24 months are free. Online admission $12/child, $8/adult, or at the gate (subject to availability) $15/child, $10/adult. Get tickets at shadybrookfarm.com. Breakfast with the Easter Bunny, with seatings at 9 and 11am for $30/person also available for reservation. 

Select Dates thru April 18th 

Elmo’s Eggstravaganza Easter Celebration at Sesame Place, 100 Sesame Road, Langhorne

Don’t miss Elmo’s Eggstravaganza on select dates! Guests can visit Sesame Place for a hoppin’ good time, with rides, shows, Sesame Street Party Parade and special Easter fun with everyone’s favorite furry friends. Pictures with the Easter bunny available. Sesameplace.com
